clinical_study.brief_title: Feasibility of Supportive Care Needs in Patients With Advanced Solid Cancer in a Therapeutic Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Observational Study Evaluating the Feasibility of a Systematic and Standardized Assessment of Supportive Care Needs in Patients With Advanced Solid Cancer at the Inclusion in a Therapeutic Trial at the Institut Curie

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess the supportive care needs of patients enrolled in a therapeutic trial for metastatic cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
All patients included in a therapeutic trial will be offered an analysis of their supportive care needs from the following options:
- dietetics
- psychological
- pain management
- Palliative medicine consultation or day hospital
- onco-geriatrics
- social assistance
- Physiotherapist care If an intervention(s) is selected, it will be offered in addition to the patient's participation in the therapeutic trial.

primary_outcome.measure: EORTC Core Quality of Life Questionnaire (EORTC QLQ-C30)
primary_outcome.description: Descritive results with validated questionnaire for the assessment of Quality of life in patient with cancer. 30 Questions

primary_outcome.measure: National Comprehensive Cancer Network (NCCN) Distress thermometer
primary_outcome.description: Descritive results with validated questionnaire for distress assessment (scale from 0 to 10 and list of problems to be ticked by the patient

Descritive results with validated questionnaire for the identification of geriatric frailties in 70 year old cancer patients. Score on 17 points: > 14 = standard care, <14 = specialized geriatric evaluation

criteria.textblock:

Exclusion Criteria:
